edu.purdue.bbc.util
Class UpdateDaemon

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      edu.purdue.bbc.util.UpdateDaemon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class UpdateDaemon
extends Thread

This class will create a background thread which will process update events in the background at minimum priority by default.

Nested Class Summary
protected static class UpdateDaemon.DaemonRunnable
          Runnable class for the Thread.

Field Detail

listeners

protected Collection<DaemonListener> listeners

runnable

protected UpdateDaemon.DaemonRunnable runnable
Constructor Detail

UpdateDaemon

protected UpdateDaemon(UpdateDaemon.DaemonRunnable runnable)
Creates a new UpdateDaemon this method is protected, so create a new daemon with the create() method.

Parameters:
runnable - The Runnable which this thread will run. This is created automatically by the create() method.
Method Detail

create

public static UpdateDaemon create(long interval)
Creates a new UpdateDaemon and returns it. This instance should then be started by calling it's start() method.

Parameters:
interval - The interval to check for new updates, in milliseconds.
Returns:
a new UpdateDaemon.

update

public void update(DaemonListener listener)
Calling this method with an object implementing DaemonListener will cause it's daemonUpdate method to be called at the next interval.

Parameters:
listener - The object to be processed.

cancelUpdate

public boolean cancelUpdate(DaemonListener listener)
Attemps to cancel the next update. If the event has not yet fired, the update will be cancelled. There is no guarantee that cancellation will succeed.

Parameters:
The - listener to cancel the update for.
Returns:
true if the cancellation was successful. False if the update has already started and thus unable to be cancelled.

kill

public void kill()
Kills the thread. At the next update, the thread will not execute and instead exit.
